column3: full_charge_description
The intentional infliction of physical or psychological injury
An intentional and unlawful threat against another person, coupled with the apparent ability to carry out the threat, which creates a genuine and reasonable fear that violence or harm is imminent
Intentionally causing bodily harm to another person without a weapon
Intentional infliction of physical or mental injury upon a child
Intentionally causing bodily harm to another person with a deadly weapon
When a person willfully, maliciously, and repeatedly follows, harasses, or cyberstalks another person
An intentional and unlawful threat against another person with a deadly weapon, or while in the commission of a felony, which creates a reasonable fear that violence or harm is imminent
To sell, purchase, manufacture, deliver, possess, or transport a trafficking amount (i.e., more than personal use) of drugs
Unlawfully entering a dwelling or structure or remaining in a dwelling or structure after permission to remain has been withdrawn, with the intent to commit a crime inside
When a person alters, destroys, suppresses or conceals any record, document or thing with purpose to impair its verity, legibility or availability in any official proceeding or investigation
When a person intentionally and unlawfully takes money or property from another person through the use of force, violence, assault, or threat
When a person knowingly carries, on or about their person, a weapon that is concealed from the ordinary sight of another person
Wrongful or criminal deception intended to result in financial or personal gain

column2: Contributing to the Delinquency Of A Minor
column3: When a person over the age of eighteen commits any act which causes, tends to cause, encourages, or contributes to a minor become delinquent, dependent, or a child in need of services
When a person falsely makes, alters, counterfeits, or forges a document that carries “legal efficacy”
When a person willfully and maliciously damages another person's property - with damage of more than $1,000
When a person willfully and maliciously damages another person's property - with damage less than $1,000
Operating a motor vehicle with a blood alcohol content (BAC) of 0.08% or higher
Possessing a criminalized narcotic or pharmacological drug with the intent to sell or deliver
Possessing cannabis with the intent to sell or deliver the cannabis
Possessing cocaine with the intent to sell or deliver the cocaine

Commiting an act that corrupts the public morals, outrages the sense of public decency, or affects the peace and quiet of persons who may witness them, or engages in brawling, fightin, or other conduct that constitutes a breach of the peace
When an intoxicated person endangers the safety of another person or property, or causes a disturbance in public
Driving with a license that has been suspended
Driving with a license that has been revoked

When a prisoner escapes or attempts to escape from a place of confinement, or when an arrested person who is being transported to or from a place of confinement escapes or attempts to escape from such lawful confinement
Driving with a license that is expired
The transfer of an accused criminal by one state or nation to another
Failure to obey the orders of a police officer
When you drive a vehicle in a manner that shows a willful disregard for the safety of persons or property
The taking of another person's property worth less than $300

When a person either forcibly, by threat, confines, abducts, imprisons, or restrains another person without lawful authority against their will, or secretly confines, abducts, imprisons, or restrains another person without lawful authority against their will
Engaging in sex for money
The unlawful taking of property worth more than $300

column2: Interference with Traffic Control Railroad Divide
column3: Unlawfully interfering with a railroad divide
When a person forcibly, secretly, or by threat confines, abducts, or imprisons another person against their will, without lawful authority

column2: Fleeing the Scene of an Accident
column3: When a person is involved in an accident or crash and willfully leaves the scene of the accident or crash without providing their information to the other individuals involved
Intentionally touching the breasts, genitals, or buttocks of a child younger than 16 in a lewd or lascivious manner
Manufacturing or cultivating cannabis

When a caregiver willfully, or through culpable negligence, fails to provide a child with the care, supervision, and services necessary to maintain the child's physical and mental health that a prudent person would consider essential for the well-being of the child

Robbing people or companies of their ideas, inventions, and creative expressions—known as “intellectual property”—which can include everything from trade secrets and proprietary products and parts to movies, music, and software
When a person knowingly carries, on or about his or her person, a weapon that is not concealed

column2: Operating a Vehicle without a Valid Drivers License
column3: Operating a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
Possession of cannabis/marijuana
Possession of Ecstasy
Possession of a criminalized narcotic or pharmacological drug
Possession of cocaine
Possession of LSD
Possession of Meth
Possession of Morphine
Possession of Oxycodone
Standing or waiting around idly in a manner unusual for law-abiding citizens, creating an imminent threat to public safety

When a person knowingly and willfully resists, obstructs, or opposes a law enforcement officer by threatening violence or engaging in violent conduct against the law enforcement officer was engaged in the lawful execution of a legal duty
When a person knowingly and willfuly, but not violently, resists, obstructs, or opposes a law enforcement officer engaged in the execution of legal process, or lawful execution of a legal duty
Violating the terms of a restraining order

Sexual assault, also known as rape, sexual abuse and sexual battery, is defined as unwanted oral, anal or vaginal penetration by, or union with, the sexual organ of another or the anal or vaginal penetration of another by any other object
When a person solicits, induces, entices, or procures another person to engage in prostitution, lewdness, or assignation
When a person intentionally and unlawfully takes money or property from another person through the use of force, violence, assault, or threat while in possession of a firearm or other deadly weapon
The act of attempting to alter or prevent the testimony of witnesses within criminal or civil proceedings

An intentional and unlawful threat against an emergency medical care provider, firefighter, or law enforcement officer, coupled with the apparent ability to carry out the threat, which creates a genuine and reasonable fear that violence or harm is imminent
Willfully entering or remaining on some form of real property without authorization, license, or invitation
When an unlicensed commercial telemarketing company or unlicensed salesperson solicits a purchaser for the purpose of attempting to sell consumer goods or services
The touching or striking of a family member, household member, or domestic partner against their will
